results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, d.name AS department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name LIKE 'Sales%' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT * FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending') AS pending_sales_orders LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products AS p JOIN product_categories AS pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id AS vendor_id, v.vendor_number AS vendor_number, v.name AS name, v.email AS email, v.phone AS phone, v.website AS website, v.address_id AS address_id, v.payment_terms AS payment_terms, v.currency_id AS currency_id, v.tax_id AS tax_id FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT acc_type.name FROM account_types acc_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number, b.bank_name, b.current_balance FROM bank_accounts b LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa JOIN asset_categories AS ac ON fa.category_id = ac.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.name AS course_name, tc.duration_hours, tc.cost, tc.is_active FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = true LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT os.name AS stage_name FROM sales_opportunities os JOIN opportunity_stages os2 ON os.stage_id = os2.stage_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name FROM countries AS c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT uom.name AS unit_measure, uom.abbreviation AS abbreviation FROM units_of_measure uom LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT fy.year FROM fiscal_years AS fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT category_id FROM fixed_assets LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, e.salary FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE DATEDIFF(year, e.hire_date, GETDATE()) > 5 AND s.amount > 100000 LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column "year" does not exist

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e INNER JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id, e.first_name, e.last_name FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id WHERE lr.status = 'pending' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS Position_Title, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS Number_of_Employees FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_certifications ec JOIN employees e ON ec.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE ec.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 months') AND ec.status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column ec.status does not exist

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.subtotal) AS total_sales FROM sales_orders JOIN customers ON sales_orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(po.total) AS total_order_value FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders po ON c.customer_id = po.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_id ORDER BY total_order_value DESC LIMIT 10;

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.* FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT o.order_id) AS total_orders, COUNT(DISTINCT q.quote_id) AS total_quotes FROM sales_orders o INNER JOIN quote_lines l ON o.order_id = l.line_id INNER JOIN sales_quotes q ON l.quote_id = q.quote_id WHERE o.status = 'completed' AND q.status = 'completed' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < r.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT w.warehouse_id, SUM(il.quantity * il.quantity) AS total_inventory_value FROM inventory_levels il JOIN warehouses w ON il.warehouse_id = w.warehouse_id GROUP BY w.warehouse_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column il.quantity does not exist

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku AS product_sku, p.name AS product_name FROM products p INNER JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' ORDER BY p.sku LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_name, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM vi.order_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY v.vendor_name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.* FROM sales_orders AS s JOIN goods_receipts AS g ON s.order_id = g.po_id WHERE s.ship_date IS NULL AND g.receipt_date < s.required_date LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE status = 'approved') / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0) AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT ca.account_number AS account_no, SUM(bt.amount) AS total_debit, SUM(ca.current_balance) AS total_credit FROM bank_accounts ca JOIN bank_transactions bt ON ca.bank_account_id = bt.bank_account_id WHERE bt.transaction_date BETWEEN (SELECT start_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE period_number = 1) AND (SELECT end_date FROM fiscal_periods WHERE period_number = 1) GROUP BY ca.account_number LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error: more than one row returned by a subquery used as an expression

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, b.total_amount AS total_budgeted, SUM(p.actual_amount) AS total_spent FROM departments d LEFT JOIN budgets b ON d.department_id = b.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets p ON b.budget_id = p.budget_id GROUP BY d.name, b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects p INNER JOIN budgets b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.budget > b.total_amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT r.project_id AS "ProjectID", p.name AS "ProjectName", r.role, r.allocation_percent, r.hourly_rate FROM project_resources r JOIN projects p ON r.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT f.name AS asset_category, SUM(f.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets f GROUP BY f.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN asset_maintenance am ON fa.asset_id = am.asset_id WHERE (am.completed_date IS NULL OR (am.completed_date >= CURRENT_DATE AND am.completed_date <= DATE_ADD(CURRENT_DATE, INTERVAL 30 DAY))) AND am.status = 'Due' LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: syntax error at or near "30"

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.entity_type, COUNT(d.attachment_id) AS num_documents FROM document_attachments d GROUP BY d.entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, (COUNT(e.employee_id) FILTER (WHERE e.termination_date IS NOT NULL AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM e.termination_date) = 2024) / COUNT(e.employee_id)) * 100 AS turnover_rate FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id GROUP BY d.name;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS employee_full_name, d.department_id, p.position_id, ps.amount, 100 * COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY e.department_id) / SUM(COUNT(*)) OVER () AS salary_percentile
FROM employees e
JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id
JOIN positions p ON e.position_id = p.position_id AND p.is_active = TRUE
JOIN employee_salaries ps ON e.employee_id = ps.employee_id AND p.is_active = TRUE
GROUP BY e.employee_id, d.department_id, p.position_id, ps.amount LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.status = 'completed' WHERE et.training_id IS NULL LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at) AS month, SUM(s.total) / COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY DATE_TRUNC('month', s.created_at)) AS avg_daily_sales FROM sales_orders s WHERE s.order_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '12 months' GROUP BY month ORDER BY month LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.segment, AVG(o.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(*) / 365.0 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.segment LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column c.segment does not exist

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM opportunity_stages.expected_close_date) AS expected_close_month, SUM(sales_opportunities.amount * (1 - sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) OVER (PARTITION BY opportunity_stages.name ORDER BY opportunity_stages.sequence) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id GROUP BY stage, expected_close_month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.name AS product_category, SUM(it.quantity) / AVG(p.unit_cost) AS inventory_turnover_ratio FROM inventory_transactions it JOIN products p ON it.product_id = p.product_id JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id GROUP BY pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_on_hand, i.quantity_available, a.quantity_change FROM products p INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id INNER JOIN adjustment_lines a ON p.product_id = a.product_id WHERE ABS(i.quantity_on_hand - (i.quantity_available + a.quantity_change)) / GREATEST(i.quantity_on_hand, i.quantity_available) > 0.1 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, AVG(CASE WHEN iv.due_date >= iv.invoice_date THEN 1 ELSE 0 END + CASE WHEN iv.amount_paid = iv.total THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS vendor_performance_score FROM vendors v JOIN purchase_orders po ON v.vendor_id = po.vendor_id JOIN vendor_invoices iv ON po.po_id = iv.po_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.category AS category, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM asset_categories ac JOIN bank_accounts ba ON ac.category_id = ba.asset_id JOIN bank_transactions bt ON ba.bank_account_id = bt.bank_account_id GROUP BY ac.category LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column ba.asset_id does not exist

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated: SELECT pb.project_id, pb.name AS project_name, SUM(pb.planned_amount) - SUM(pe.actual_amount) AS total_expense_difference FROM budgets pb INNER JOIN project_budgets pb ON pb.budget_id = pb.budget_id INNER JOIN project_expenses pe ON pb.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pb.project_id, pb.name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 1 attempts: table name "pb" specified more than once

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.project_id AS project_id, pe.employee_id AS employee_id, pr.role AS role, SUM(pr.allocation_percent * 24) AS total_hours_allocated FROM project_resources pr JOIN employees pe ON pr.employee_id = pe.employee_id WHERE pr.project_id IN (SELECT p.project_id FROM projects p WHERE p.status = 'active') AND EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM employees e WHERE e.is_active = TRUE) GROUP BY pr.project_id, pe.employee_id, pr.role LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id AS asset_id, fa.name AS name, fa.location_id AS location_id, e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name AS first_name, e.last_name AS last_name FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN employees e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;
